description: Technical information gathering consists of the process of identifying critical technical elements of intelligence an adversary will need about a target in order to best attack.  Technical intelligence gathering includes, but is not limited to, understanding the target's network architecture, IP space, network services, email format, and security procedures.
name: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATT&CK Matrix - Technical Information Gathering

values.description: Open source intelligence (OSINT) is intelligence gathered from publicly available sources. This can include both information gathered on-line, such as from search engines, as well as in the physical world.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1247 Acquire OSINT data sets and information

values.description: Passive scanning is the act of looking at existing network traffic in order to identify information about the communications system.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1253 Conduct passive scanning

values.description: Social Engineering is the practice of manipulating people in order to get them to divulge information or take an action.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1249 Conduct social engineering

values.description: Infrastructure services includes the hardware, software, and network resources required to operate a communications environment. This infrastructure can be managed by a 3rd party rather than being managed by the owning organization.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1260 Determine 3rd party infrastructure services

values.description: Domain Names are the human readable names used to represent one or more IP addresses. IP addresses are the unique identifier of computing devices on a network. Both pieces of information are valuable to an adversary who is looking to understand the structure of a network.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1250 Determine domain and IP address space

values.description: Network trusts enable communications between different networks with specific accesses and permissions. Network trusts could include the implementation of domain trusts or the use of virtual private networks (VPNs).
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1259 Determine external network trust dependencies

values.description: Firmware is permanent software programmed into the read-only memory of a device. As with other types of software, firmware may be updated over time and have multiple versions.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1258 Determine firmware version

values.description: Email addresses, logon credentials, and other forms of online identification typically share a common format. This makes guessing other credentials within the same domain easier. For example if a known email address is first.last@company.com it is likely that others in the company will have an email in the same format.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1255 Discover target logon and (or) email address format

values.description: Client configurations information such as the operating system and web browser, along with additional information such as version or language, are often transmitted as part of web browsing communications. This can be accomplished in several ways including use of a compromised web site to collect details on visiting computers.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1262 Enumerate client configurations

values.description: Software applications will be built using different technologies, languages, and dependencies. This information may reveal vulnerabilities or opportunities to an adversary.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1261 Enumerate externally facing software applications technologies, languages, and dependencies

values.description: Job postings, on either company sites, or in other forums, provide information on organizational structure and often provide contact information for someone within the organization. This may give an adversary information on technologies within the organization which could be valuable in attack or provide insight in to possible security weaknesses or limitations in detection or protection mechanisms.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1248 Identify job postings and needs and (or) gaps

values.description: Security defensive capabilities are designed to stop or limit unauthorized network traffic or other types of accesses.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1263 Identify security defensive capabilities

values.description: Supply chains include the people, processes, and technologies used to move a product or service from a supplier to a consumer. Understanding supply chains may provide an adversary with opportunities to exploit the technology or interconnections that are part of the supply chain.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1246 Identify supply chains

values.description: Technology usage patterns include identifying if users work offsite, connect remotely, or other possibly less restricted and (or) secured access techniques.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1264 technology usage patterns

values.description: An adversary can attempt to identify web defensive services as CloudFlare, IPBan, and Snort. This may be done by passively detecting services, like CloudFlare routing, or actively, such as by purposefully tripping security defenses.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1256 Identify web defensive services

values.description: A network topology is the arrangement of the various elements of a network (e.g., servers, workstations, printers, routers, firewalls, etc.). Mapping a network allows an adversary to understand how the elements are connected or related.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1252 Map network topology

values.description: Technical blogs and forums provide a way for technical staff to ask for assistance or troubleshoot problems. In doing so they may reveal information such as operating system (OS), network devices, or applications in use.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1257 Mine technical blogs and (or) forums

values.description: For a computing resource to be accessible to the public, domain names and IP addresses must be registered with an authorized organization.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1251 Obtain domain and (or) IP registration information

values.description: Spearphishing for information is a specific variant of spearphishing. Spearphishing for information is different from other forms of spearphishing in that it it doesn't leverage malicious code. All forms of spearphishing are elctronically delivered social engineering targeted at a specific individual, company, or industry. Spearphishing for information is an attempt to trick targets into divulging information, frequently credentials, without involving malicious code. Spearphishing for information frequently involves masquerading as a source with a reason to collect information (such as a system administrator or a bank) and providing a user with a website link to visit. The given website often closely resembles a legitimate site in appearance and has a URL containing elements from the real site. From the fake website, information is gathered in web forms and sent to the attacker. Spearphishing for information may also try to obtain information directly through the exchange of emails, instant messengers or other electronic conversation means.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1397 Spearphishing for Information

values.description: Active scanning is the act of sending transmissions to end nodes, and analyzing the responses, in order to identify information about the communications system.
values.value: OSRS MITRE Pre-ATK Technical Information Gathering: T1254 Conduct active scanning
